sn56.56:1.1: “Mendicants, suppose the great earth was worn away and eroded except for seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds.
sn56.56:1.3: Which is more: the great earth that has been worn away and eroded, or the seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds that are left?”
sn56.56:1.4: “Sir, the great earth that has been worn away and eroded is certainly more. The seven clay balls the size of jujube seeds are tiny.
sn56.56:1.5: Compared to the great earth that has been worn away and eroded, they can’t be reckoned or compared, they’re not even a fraction.”
sn56.56:1.6: “In the same way, for a noble disciple …
sn56.56:1.7: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
